meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being viviparous.
meanings.sent1: The viviparities of mammals allow them to give birth to live young.
meanings.sent2: In biology class, we learned about the viviparities of certain animals.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the viviparities of the kangaroos made them excellent parents.
meanings.sent4: Her nurturing nature was a viviparities that defined her as a caregiver.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of the viviparities of nature stayed with me long after the lesson.

meanings.definition: The state of giving birth to live young rather than laying eggs.
meanings.sent1: The viviparities of the rabbit surprised the children at the petting zoo.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the viviparities of different species to understand reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The viviparities of the seahorse made it a unique creature in the ocean.
meanings.sent4: The viviparities of the tree symbolized growth and new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showcased the fascinating viviparities of various animals in the wild.
